name: John F. ZETTICK and Richard Kus v. BOARD OF SUPERVISORS OF RICHLAND TOWNSHIP, Appellant

judges: Before NIX, C.J., and LARSEN, FLAHERTY, McDERMOTT, ZAPPALA, PAPADAKOS and CAPPY, JJ.
parties: John F. ZETTICK and Richard Kus v. BOARD OF SUPERVISORS OF RICHLAND TOWNSHIP, Appellant.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM:
Appeal dismissed as having been improvidently granted.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM:

attorneys: Robert B. McKinstry, Jr., Winifred M. Prendergast, Philadelphia, for appellant.
William J. Carlin, John P. Koopman, Langhorne, for appellees.
casebody.head_matter:
583 A.2d 789
John F. ZETTICK and Richard Kus v. BOARD OF SUPERVISORS OF RICHLAND TOWNSHIP, Appellant.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Argued Dec. 3, 1990.
Decided Jan. 7, 1991.
Robert B. McKinstry, Jr., Winifred M. Prendergast, Philadelphia, for appellant.
William J. Carlin, John P. Koopman, Langhorne, for appellees.
Before NIX, C.J., and LARSEN, FLAHERTY, McDERMOTT, ZAPPALA, PAPADAKOS and CAPPY, JJ.
